uzbek.prodiom: Қўшнининг қудуғига тупурма, охир бир кун сув ичарсан
uzbek.explanation: Do not spit into the neighbor's well, you may drink water from it one day. The prodiom says not to hurt your neighbors, as you may be in need for their help one day

uzbek.prodiom: Гилам сотсанг, қўшнинга сот –бир чекасида ўзинг ўтирасан
uzbek.explanation: If you want to sell your carpet sell it to your neighbor, because you may sit on it one day. It means that neighbors live close to one another that is essential that they borrow or lend each other's utensils.

uzbek.prodiom: Яҳши қўшнингдан сўрагунча, ёмон уйингдан қидир
uzbek.explanation: Do not borrow from your "good" neighbor, search it in your "bad" house. It means that there exist such gready neighbors that never share or lend their things with anybody, even with the neighbors. That is why one had better not try to borrow their things
A neighbor's thing is only borrowed, you should give it back again
Before buying a house be sure that your neighbor is a good person
uzbek.equivalent: Seek the neighbor before the house, the companion before the journey

uzbek.explanation: You will in peace if your neighbors have peace
uzbek.equivalent: My next neighbor’s scathe is my present peril

uzbek.explanation: Good neighbor is always by your side, especially in difficult days
uzbek.equivalent: Good neighbor, a good morrow

uzbek.explanation: A neighbor is consolation for a neighbor

uzbek.prodiom: Қўшнинг кўр бўлса кўзингни қис, оқсоқ бўлса ланг бўл
uzbek.explanation: If your neighbor is blind screw your eyes, if he is cripple be gimp. It means that if your neighbor has a deficit or a fault, never humiliate him/her, on the contrary try to take the perspective of theirs.
A neighbor teaches a neighbor to get up early. It means that a neighbor learns from his neighbor, repeats his/ her habits.
uzbek.equivalent: Every man’s neighbor is his looking glass

uzbek.explanation: Check your neighbor in rainy days. It means that if you want to know whether your neighbor is good or bad test him/ her when you have problems by asking them to help

uzbek.prodiom: Болани сўксанг, бети қотар, урсанг эти қотар
uzbek.explanation: If your scold and beat your child he becomes much worse. That is whay parents had better bring-up the children with patience as often as possible.

uzbek.prodiom: Меҳмоннинг ўзи ҳам меҳмон, сўзи ҳам меҳмон
uzbek.explanation: The guest's words are also guest. It means that when your are a guest, try not to offend the host with unpleasant or wrong words.

uzbek.prodiom: Чолимнинг топганини яйраб ейман, ўғлимнинг топганини инграб ейман
uzbek.explanation: I eat my husband's food with joy, but my son's with discomfort. It means that parents usually feel discomfort when their children buy something for their parents, since they think that children have their own expences.

uzbek.prodiom: Қайнонага тош отсанг, тош оласан, қайнонага ош берсанг, ош оласан
uzbek.explanation: If you treat you father-in-law badly he will do the same, if you be kind to your mother-in-law, she will do the same
A house with constant scandals is like a cemetry

uzbek.prodiom: Оила аҳил бўлса, тоғдагини олдирар, оила ноаҳил бўлса, қўлидагини олдирар
uzbek.explanation: Well-being of a family depends on how friendly they are.
uzbek.equivalent: In a united family, happiness springs up of itself

uzbek.explanation: One cannot cut off his nose though it is stinky. It means that you can not get rid of your relatives forever even though if they are bad

uzbek.prodiom: Подшонинг аҳмоғи ер талашади, хотиннинг аҳмоғи эр талашади.
uzbek.explanation: If the king is fool he cannot share the land, a fool woman cannot share his husband. It means that if something does not belong to you or if the husbands want to divorce with you should never argue.

uzbek.prodiom: Тенг тенги билан - тезак қопи билан
uzbek.explanation: One should marry according to his character, education and others
uzbek.equivalent: Every Jack has his Jill

uzbek.explanation: If the son does not take after his father, so he is not his son. It means that nearly always sons are the copies of their fathers.

uzbek.prodiom: Хасис отадан гоҳ саҳий ўғил чиқади
uzbek.explanation: A greedy father's son turns out to be a generous person
Every mother thinks his child is the best
uzbek.equivalent: There is only one pretty child in the world, and every mother has

uzbek.explanation: Your genes show what kind a person you are
uzbek.equivalent: Blood will tell

uzbek.explanation: Marriage is a fist. It means that Marriage is a difficult thing. It demands from husband and wife to struggle to live well and be hapy together
uzbek.equivalent: Wedlock is padlock

uzbek.prodiom: Бойнинг хотини бўлгунча, камбағалнинг кавуши бўл
uzbek.explanation: It is better to be a poor man's shoes than a rich man's wife. It is better for a woman to marry a poor man who treats her well than a controlling rich man.
uzbek.equivalent: Better be a man’s darling than a rich man’s slave

uzbek.explanation: Marry your daughter to the man that is equal to her
uzbek.equivalent: There is Jack for every Jill

uzbek.prodiom: Бойга келин бўлгунча, камбағалга қиз бўл
uzbek.explanation: It is better to be a poor man's daughter than a rich man's wife.
uzbek.equivalent: He that sells his liberty marries for wealth

uzbek.prodiom: Она оёғи билан бешик тебратар, қўли билан рўзғор тебратар
uzbek.explanation: A mother is a creature with such a strong will who is capable of educating children, managing the family and the chores in the house
uzbek.equivalent: The foot on the cradle and hand on the distaff is the sign of a good housewife

uzbek.prodiom: Хотининг ёмон бўлса, азага бормоқ на ҳожат?!
uzbek.explanation: A bad wife is like a funeral. It means that a life with a bad life is like a funeral which is usually groomy
uzbek.equivalent: There is no devil so bad as а she devil

uzbek.explanation: A wife without the husband is a like a horse without the head.
uzbek.equivalent: If the husband be not at home, there is nobody

uzbek.explanation: No one, even close, blood relatives cannot substitute the mother in the family
uzbek.equivalent: One good mother is worth a hundred schoolmasters

uzbek.explanation: Even one thousand aunts in one cannot substitute one mother. It means that the mother is irreplaceable for her children
uzbek.equivalent: An ounce of mother is worth a ton of priest

uzbek.prodiom: Бола ҳам она дейди, она ҳам она дейди
uzbek.explanation: Every child strives to be together with the mother.
uzbek.equivalent: A man’s mother is his other God

uzbek.explanation: There is no secret in the family where there are a children
uzbek.equivalent: What children hear at hоme soon flies abroad

uzbek.prodiom: Мезбон борин қўйса, меҳмон озга санамас
uzbek.explanation: The host serves as well as possible, but the guest should be grateful no matter what the quality of the service is.
uzbek.equivalent: Eat at pleasure, drink with measure

uzbek.explanation: The next door neighbor is better than a distant relative.
uzbek.equivalent: Better a neighbor than a brother far off

english.prodiom: Hope chest
english.explanation: Қизни турмушга узатишда унга бериладиган сарпо
english.example: It was a tradition for girls to have a hope chest before Marriage.

english.prodiom: Get hitched
english.explanation: Боғланмоқ (Йигит ва қизнинг бир-бири билан бутун умрга боғланиши)
english.example: Is Mary getting hitched?

english.prodiom: Walk down the aisle together
english.explanation: Ўриндиқлар қаторидан бирга юриб ўтмоқ
english.example: They are finally walking down the aisle together

english.prodiom: Tie the knot
english.explanation: Тугун боғламоқ
english.example: To tie the knot is not an easy decision

english.prodiom: Рerfect couple
english.explanation: Идеал жуфтлик
english.example: I hope they will be a perfect couple

english.prodiom: The one for someone
english.explanation: Бир киши учун ягона
english.example: Sue is the one for her sweet-heart

english.prodiom: Bottom drawer
english.explanation: Жавоннинг қуйи тортмаси
english.example: What things are there in your bottom drawer?

english.prodiom: Оn the shelf
english.explanation: Токчада
english.example: In those days, if you hadn't married by the time you were 35, you were definitely on the shelf

english.prodiom: Mr.Right Ms.Right
english.explanation: Жаноб ва хоним Тўғри
english.example: I think I am in love with Ruth - she is Ms Right for me

english.prodiom: Make a match of
english.explanation: Тенгини топиш
english.example: The theme of making a match of young boys and girls was depicted in a lot of English novels.

english.prodiom: Turn someone down
english.explanation: Рад этмоқ (совчиларни)
english.example: Emma's mother turned Jack down as she considered him not appropriate for her

english.prodiom: White Wedding
english.explanation: Оқ тўй (Черковда бўлиб ўтадиган никоҳ тўйи)
english.example: White Wedding is dream of every woman

english.prodiom: Set a date
english.explanation: Санани белгилаш (тўй санаси)
english.example: We need to consult with the parents on setting date issue

english.prodiom: Cat and dog life
english.explanation: Ит ва мушук ҳаёти (эр ва хотин муносабатлари)
english.example: Cat and dog life exists in each family, even though for a short period of time

english.prodiom: Get on like a house on a fire
english.explanation: Оловдаги уй каби бўлмоқ (Муроса қилиб, келишиб иноқ яшаш)
english.example: No one expected them to get on like a house on a fire

english.prodiom: Break bread with someone
english.explanation: Ким биландир нонни бўлишиб емоқ (Баҳам кўрмоқ)
english.example: A host's principal task in to break bread with a guest

english.prodiom: Keep the home fires burning
english.explanation: Уйни ёниб кетишидан сақламоқ (Уйни яҳши аҳволда сақлаш)
english.example: To keep the home fires burning is every family member's responsibility

english.prodiom: Henpecked husband
english.explanation: Товон остидаги эр (Хотинига бўйсинувчи эр)
english.example: Jane's husband is known as a henpecked husband in the neighbourhood

english.prodiom: Wear the breeches
english.explanation: Шим киймоқ (Оилада ҳукмрон, устун бўлган аёл ҳақида)
english.example: It's obvious who wears the britches in that family

english.prodiom: The grey mare
english.explanation: Кулранг бия (Оилада ҳукмрон бўлган аёлга берилган ном)
english.example: She would smile when her friends called her grey mare

english.prodiom: Be pinned to wife’s apron string
english.explanation: Хотинининг этагига ёпишган
english.example: Jim was pinned to his wife's apron string and was never embarrased by it

english.prodiom: Green - eyed monster
english.explanation: Яшил кўзли маҳлуқ (рашк қилувчи киши ҳақида)
english.example: What are the symptoms of a green-eyed monster's illness?

english.prodiom: Mommy’s boy
english.explanation: Онасининг эркатойи
english.example: He was too naughty, besides being a mommy's boy used to his life style

english.prodiom: Make yourself at home
english.explanation: Ўзингизни ўз уйингиздек хис этинг
english.example: It is an important thing to let guests make themselves at home

english.prodiom: To give a hearty welcome
english.explanation: Илиқ кутиб олмоқ
english.example: Guests from Africa were given a hearty welcome

english.prodiom: To roll out the red carpet
english.explanation: Очиқ чеҳра билан кутиб олмоқ
english.example: To my wonder she rolled out the red carpet just at a midnight

english.prodiom: Help yourself
english.explanation: Олишиб ўтиринг, олинг
english.example: Help yourself with fresh buns!

english.prodiom: To give a tea party
english.explanation: Имлама зиёфат уюштирмоқ
english.example: The Browns are giving a tea party on behalf of their victory

english.prodiom: To give a luncheon party
english.explanation: Имлама зиёфат уюштирмоқ
english.example: The lord would give a lunacheon party at a New Year Eve

english.prodiom: To play host
english.explanation: Mеҳмон кутмоқ
english.example: Who plays host this year?

english.prodiom: А hospitable welcome
english.explanation: Mеҳмонни ҳурмат билан кутиб олмоқ
english.example: When visiting a neighbor or relative's house, guests enjoy a hospitable welcome

english.prodiom: To keep a good table
english.explanation: Меҳмоннавоз бўлмоқ
english.example: I kept a good table when my guests visited me

english.prodiom: Shoulder to shoulder
english.explanation: Елкама елка
english.example: Another secret of a happy Marriage is to live shoulder to shoulder in any situations

english.prodiom: Family tree
english.explanation: Оила дараҳти
english.example: My family tree can be traced back to the eighteenth century.

english.prodiom: Run in the family
english.explanation: Авлодида бўлмоқ
english.example: Dark black hair and black eyes run in my family

english.prodiom: To have a falling out
english.explanation: Жанжаллашмоқ
english.example: Margaret and her husband had a falling out a few years back

english.prodiom: Parting of the ways
english.explanation: Йўллари айро бўлмоқ
english.example: After a fifteen happy life they parted of their ways for unknown reasons
